results.title: Blade II
results.creator_credit: Guillermo del Toro, Patrick Palmer, Wesley Snipes, Peter Frankfurt and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Based on Marvel Comics more dark super hero franchise, “Blade II” chronicles the adventures of a half human, half vampire (Wesley Snipes) who diligently protects humans from the seething vampire underworld. Mexican horror director Guillermo del Toro (The Devil’s backbone, Cronos) has fashioned a faithful sequel which delves deeper into the vampire mythology set up in the first film while maintaining the series penchant for blood soaked martial arts action. Set in Prague (its gothic buildings and ancient cobblestoned streets make this a fitting location for a vampire movie), “Blade II“‘s action takes off when a new breed of vampires are discovered, the Deadly Reapers. These nasty nightcrawlers not only feed on humans but are not impartial to vampire blood as well. This causes the worried vampire fraternity (known as the Shadow Council) to form an uneasy alliance with arch-enemy Blade and his gruff side-kick Whistler (Kris Kristofferson). Together they must hunt down and destroy the rapidly spreading reapers before they eliminate all the vampires and take over the human race. Cast includes: Luke Goss, Ron Perlman, Leonor Varela, Norman Reedus.

results.title: Blade II
results.brief_description: A rare mutation has occurred within the vampire community - The Reaper. A vampire so consumed with an insatiable bloodlust that they prey on vampires as well as humans, transforming victims who are unlucky enough to survive into Reapers themselves. Blade is asked by the Vampire Nation for his help in preventing a nightmare plague that would wipe out both humans and vampires.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

results.title: Blade
results.creator_credit: Stephen Norrington, Robert Engelman, Wesley Snipes, Peter Frankfurt and Amen Ra Films
results.brief_description: This very sleek vampire thriller comes with a strange trio of superheroes. Whistler (Kris Kristofferson), a terminally ill motor mechanic whose lost his family to vampires; haematologist Karen (N’Bushe Wright) who carries the vampire blood but has the medical background to cure herself, and Blade (Wesley Snipes), part human and part vampire since he became infected while in his mother’s womb. Blade’s DNA holds the key to completing the Blood Tide - an event that will turn the rest of the population into vampires. Deacon Frost (Stephen Dorff), arch enemy of Blade and an upstart wannabe vampire (Frost became a vampire after being bitten and is not one of the pure breeds who has been a blood sucker since birth), is leading the charge to achieve Blood Tide, and he has the support of vampires to achieve it. Only 3 people stand in his way. From the opening sequence of the film that depicts a nightclub with a difference, this vibrant mixture of martial arts and rock video provides a very different take on the vampire genre. Cast also includes Donal Logue, Udo Kier and Traci Lords. Based on characters included in “Marvel comics”.

results.title: Blackwood
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Richly woven of fine threads that mingle and separate, surface and disappear, this poetic documentary studies the works of one of Canada’s greatest contemporary etchers: Newfoundland-born David Blackwood. The artist himself guides the viewer through a step-by-step explanation of the entire etching process. Scenes of his hometown, examples of his masterfully crafted prints, and the vivid tales of an old mariner recall the tragic seal hunts and a way of life that has now vanished. (Awards: Yorkton, Brussels, Paris)

results.title: Blacksmith workshop
results.creator_credit: Howard Cotton, Southern Illinois University and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Artists at the “blacksmith workshop” learn blacksmithing a creative medium. After a few hours of instruction, students begin working on anvils and forges, and as they become familiar with the technique, they turn and shape the iron pieces Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: Blacksad: Under the Skin
results.brief_description: BLACKSAD: Under the Skin - A dark corruption scandal in the heart of the New York City’s underworld for charismatic detective John Blacksad!

constellations_other.name: City of animals (Hollow Knight - Production Design)
constellations_other.description: The adorable bugs that occupy Hallownest in the game Hollow Knight aren't the first anthropomorphised critters in film.

results.description: In 1950s New York, Joe Dunn, the owner of a humble boxing club is found hanged. At the same time, Robert Yale, his protege and greatest hope, is reported missing. Although overwhelmed by these terrible events, Joe Dunn’s daughter, Sonia, decides to continue working towards her father’s dreams: she takes over the boxing club and calls on John Blacksad to investigate this mysterious disappearance. It’s the eve of the fight of the year and the club, which is in serious financial difficulties, will not survive Robert’s withdrawal. The investigation will lead John Blacksad to the very heart of a world in which corruption reigns supreme.

The investigation will lead John Blacksad to the very heart of a world in which corruption reigns supreme.

results.title: Blackrock
results.creator_credit: Steven Vidler, David Elfick, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: The badly beaten, gang-raped corpse of a 15 year old girl is discovered on a deserted stretch of beach after an all-night beach party, celebrating the return of local surfing legend, Ricko, goes out of control. The working class Australian coastal community of Blackrock goes into an uproar, and is promptly splintered by shame, deceit and mistrust. 17 year old Jared (who organised Ricko’s party at the local surf club), is left with the wrenching decision whether or not to rat on his mates. Cast includes Laurence Breuls, Linda Cropper, Simon Lyndon, Chris Haywood, Rebecca Smart, Essie Davis and Jessica Napier.

results.title: Blackout: poison [Widescreen] (A)
results.creator_credit: Michael Riley and ABC-TV (Australia). Indigenous Program Unit
results.brief_description: Using real photos, images, staged settings and live performances, this episode, the first in the “Blackout” series, looks at the issues of assimilation, forced adoption and sexual abuse - particularly in respect of how it can lead to addictive personalities. It is also about the universal struggle of wanting to be loved, needed and accepted. The story centres around four people sharing a city squat, 24 hours in the lives of Raylene (Lydia Miller), Wayne (Russell Page), Laniece (Rhoda Roberts) and Sharon (Lillian Crombie) as they are involved in a drunken and stoned evening out, each plagued by their past and struggling to move forward with their future. Cast also includes Willurai Kirkbright Burney. Performances arranged by Stephen Page.

results.title: Blackout: best kept secret: a profile of Archie Roach singer/songwriter (A)
results.creator_credit: Llew Cleaver, Richard Reisz and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: ‘Best kept secret: a profile of Archie Roach singer/songwriter is part of ABC’s ‘Blackout’ series and provides an intimate account of one of one of Australia’s most popular contemporary indigenous performers. The video examines how Archie’s stolen childhood has affected his life and his music.
